alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 29 at 11:11PM PDT until May 01 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon... Sprague River near Beatty affecting Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County and Klamath Basin zones. .Warm temperatures have resulted in significant snow melt and increased river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Sprague River near Beatty. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Widespread agricultural flooding can be expected downstream in the Sprague River Valley in the vicinity of Sprague River and Lone Pine. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1115 AM PDT.

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
